protocol_name: 2×CTAB Protocol for predominantly host DNA isolation from symbiotic Aiptasia
protocol_name_html: 2×CTAB Protocol for predominantly host DNA isolation from symbiotic Aiptasia
description:
This protocol is kit-free and can be used to isolate high quality genomic DNA of predominantly Aiptasia from symbiotic anemones which can be used e.g. as PCR template for genotyping.

 

It is based on the method described in Coffroth et al., 1992.
before_start:
Recipes:

2×CTAB Buffer

(Coffroth et al. (1992) Marine Biology 114: 317-325)

 

End concentrations:                                             For 100 ml buffer mix:

1.4 M              NaCl                                                            28 ml of a 5 M stock solution

20 mM            EDTA (pH 8)                                                 4 ml of a 0.5 M stock solution

100 mM          Tris/HCl (pH 8)                                          10 ml of a 1 M stock solution

2% (w/v)        CTAB powder                                               2 g

Add after filter sterilization under a hood:

0.2% (v/v)      β-mercaptoethanol (TOXIC!!!)             200 µl

 

  • Add ddH2O to just under 100 ml.
  • Warm to 65°C under stirring to bring the CTAB into solution.
  • Once dissolved, bring final volume to 100 ml using a graduated cylinder.
  • Filter sterilize (0.2 µm) into sterile 50 ml Falcon tubes and store at −20°C.

Heat to 65°C before usage since freezing leads precipitation of the CTAB.

materials.reagent_name: Glass beads, acid-washed, 425-600 μm (30-40 U.S. sieve)
Ethyl alcohol, Pure 200 proof, for molecular biology
Microcentrifuge tubes (1.5 or 2 ml, screw-cap or safe-lock)
0.5 M EDTA Stock Solution (adjusted to pH 8.0 with NaOH)
1 M Tris/HCl Stock Solution (dissolved Tris base adjusted to pH 8.0 with HCl)
Phenol/Chloroform/Isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1), stabilized, saturated with 100 mM Tris-EDTA to pH 8.0
Nuclease-free water (e.g. MilliQ or HPLC grade water)

warning:
Safety Remarks: Be sure to follow chemical safety procedures. β-Mercaptoethanol and Phenol are very toxic if inhaled, ingested or by skin contact. So, read the safety data sheets, work under a hood for at least the Phenol and Chloroform steps, wear nitrile gloves (don’t re-use them), safety glasses and a lab coat. If you never worked with Phenol:Chloroform before, ask someone who did about handling of it!

 

Waste Disposal: Follow guidelines of your intitution for disposal. E.g. discard bottom organic layers in liquid Phenol-Chloroform waste container, the tubes and glass beads into solid Phenol-Chloroform waste container.
manuscript_citation: Coffroth, M. A., Lasker, H. R., Diamond, M. E., Bruenn, J. A., & Bermingham, E. (1992). DNA fingerprints of a gorgonian coral: a method for detecting clonal structure in a vegetative species. Marine Biology, 114(2), 317-325.
keywords: DNA Isolation, genomic DNA, Symbiodinium genotyping

collections.protocol_name: Getting started with the Aiptasia-Symbiodinium Model System
collections.protocol_name_html: Getting started with the Aiptasia-Symbiodinium Model System

guidelines:
Make sure to use Phenol:Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1) which is buffered with TE to a neutral to slightly basic pH (everthing starting from 6.7 should work) since DNA stability decreases at acidic pH (the opposite is true for RNA).

 

Be sure not to exceed the maximal ×g for which your microcentrifuge tubes are certified otherwise they might get damaged during centrifugation and release all the hazards substances (and the DNA of course) into the rotor. You don't want that!

 

If making your own stock solutions of RNase A from powder be aware that some products contain DNase impurities. If this should be the case you need to boil the stock solutions once for 15-20 min at 100°C and let cool down at room temperature to inactivate the DNases.

components.data:
Homogenize anemone with a rotor-stator in 500 µl 2× CTAB buffer individually in screw-cap or safe-lock 1.5-2 ml microcentrifuge tubes.

This is important for the Phenol extraction; simple tubes might leak!Make sure your tubes tolerate the chemicals and centrifugation forces! 

Make sure to clean the rotor thouroughly afterwards.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Homogenize anemone with a rotor-stator in 500 µl 2× CTAB buffer individually in screw-cap or safe-lock 1.5-2 ml microcentrifuge tubes.

This is important for the Phenol extraction; simple tubes might leak!Make sure your tubes tolerate the chemicals and centrifugation forces! 

Make sure to clean the rotor thouroughly afterwards.

source_data.body: The 2-Mercaptoethanol in the CTAB buffer is toxic if inhaled, swallowed or at skin contact.

components.data:
Do 5 rounds of sheering through a 25-gauge needle.

Important: DNA in host-algae homogenate in SDS or water will degrade rapidly with every freeze-thaw cycle! If you want to perform DNA isolation from these samples later, freeze the samples after step 6.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Do 5 rounds of sheering through a 25-gauge needle.

Important: DNA in host-algae homogenate in SDS or water will degrade rapidly with every freeze-thaw cycle! If you want to perform DNA isolation from these samples later, freeze the samples after step 6.

components.data: Add 3.6 µl of Proteinase K (20 mg/ml). Mix by inverting several times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 3.6 µl of Proteinase K (20 mg/ml). Mix by inverting several times.

components.data:
Incubate at 65°C for 30-60 min. Invert occasionally while incubating.

The suspension should become green and less opaque when the cells lyse. 20 min should be enough for less dense samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Incubate at 65°C for 30-60 min. Invert occasionally while incubating.

The suspension should become green and less opaque when the cells lyse. 20 min should be enough for less dense samples.

components.data:
Add 600 µl Phenol:Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1, TE-buffered to pH ≥ 7, very TOXIC!!!), mix thoroughly by vortexing several seconds.

This should result in a milky emulsion with two phases starting to form.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 600 µl Phenol:Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (25:24:1, TE-buffered to pH ≥ 7, very TOXIC!!!), mix thoroughly by vortexing several seconds.

This should result in a milky emulsion with two phases starting to form.

source_data.body:
Phenol is carcinogenic and causes chemical burns at skin contact.
Chloroform is a carcinogen and an irritant.

components.data: Centrifuge for 10 min at 14,000 ×g to separate the phases.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 10 min at 14,000 ×g to separate the phases.

components.data: Take ~550 µl of the aqueous, upper phase without disturbing the interphase and transfer to a new tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take ~550 µl of the aqueous, upper phase without disturbing the interphase and transfer to a new tube.

components.data:
Add 500 µl of Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (24:1), mix thoroughly by vortexing several seconds.

You can also use plain Chloroform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 500 µl of Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (24:1), mix thoroughly by vortexing several seconds.

You can also use plain Chloroform.

source_data.body: Chloroform is a carcinogen and an irritant.

source_data.description: Centrifuge for 10 min at 14,000 ×g.

components.data:
Take ~450 µl of the aqueous, upper phase and transfer to a new tube.

Do NOT disturb the interphase!
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Take ~450 µl of the aqueous, upper phase and transfer to a new tube.

Do NOT disturb the interphase!

components.data: Add 1 ml of 100% ethanol (molecular biology grade) and mix well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 ml of 100% ethanol (molecular biology grade) and mix well.
Incubate for ≥30 min at RT.

components.data:
Centrifuge for ≥30 min at 14,000 ×g at RT.

Be sure to orient all tubes in the same direction to know on which side the pellet will form.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Centrifuge for ≥30 min at 14,000 ×g at RT.

Be sure to orient all tubes in the same direction to know on which side the pellet will form.

components.data:
Decant supernatant.

You might not see any pellet at this step. Just be careful to not scratch off the DNA from the side where the pellet should be.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Decant supernatant.

You might not see any pellet at this step. Just be careful to not scratch off the DNA from the side where the pellet should be.

components.data: Add 500 µl 70% ethanol, don’t mix, centrifuge for 5 min at 14,000 ×g.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µl 70% ethanol, don’t mix, centrifuge for 5 min at 14,000 ×g.

components.data:
Remove the supernatant carefully with a pipet, without disturbing the pellet.

It helps to use a 1000 µl pipette with a respective tip and add a 200 µl tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove the supernatant carefully with a pipet, without disturbing the pellet.

It helps to use a 1000 µl pipette with a respective tip and add a 200 µl tip.

components.data: Air-dry for 10 min or until no Ethanol is visible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Air-dry for 10 min or until no Ethanol is visible.

components.data:
Add 30 µl ddH2O or 10 mM Tris/HCl pH 8.5 to the pellet.

You can also use TE (Tris-EDTA) buffer but be aware that the EDTA might interfere with downstream enzymatic reactions.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 30 µl ddH2O or 10 mM Tris/HCl pH 8.5 to the pellet.

You can also use TE (Tris-EDTA) buffer but be aware that the EDTA might interfere with downstream enzymatic reactions.

components.data: Store the samples at −20°C indefinitely or use them directly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Store the samples at −20°C indefinitely or use them directly.
Pellet algae at 10,000 ×g for 5-10 min.

components.data: Transfer the supernatant into a new tube. Discard the tube with the algal pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the supernatant into a new tube. Discard the tube with the algal pellet.

components.data:
Add 8 µl of RNase A (10 mg/ml stock concentration) to the sample, mix well and incubate at 37°C for 30 min.

During this step the RNA from the sample is degraded and removed during the next steps. If you started with a lot of sample material, prolong this step to 1 h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

During this step the RNA from the sample is degraded and removed during the next steps. If you started with a lot of sample material, prolong this step to 1 h.

This should result in a milky emulsion with two phases starting to form.
